http://story.news.yahoo.com/news?tmpl=story&u=/ap/20050216/ap_on_re_eu/russia_syria
 
 Russia supplying missiles to Syria has brought Israel out of the closet on an international basis, after US administration focused the US public on Syria being a 'threat to Iraqi democracy' with no mention of Israel's concerns. Russia has no oil supply problems and deals in Euros, Syria has recently been accepted for EU trade agreements and Condi Rice is, for once thank patience, silent. Will we again wave the flag to refocus the American public on this threat to spreading democracy in the ME at the point of a gun, or let sovereign nations mind their own business?
daewoo

It should certainly be interesting to see how this plays out, especially in light of Iran and Syrias announcement today.
 
 It was intreresting to watch currency and US equity markets respond to the newa about the explosion in Iran today. The firs trealisation that something had happend for me came when I glanced at my inbox and it was full of pre-programmd stock and currency alerts. The dollar was quickly headed into the toilet, as was the US stock market. It was not until after we became reasonably certain that this was not a first strike by the US that the dollar and stock market went back to previous levels.
 
 I think we can infer from this what direction the majority of the world thinks such a confrontation is likely to go, at least for our economy.
 
 It was nice to see condi quiet through the russian announcement and the iranian event. If she had opened her mouth, she might very well have tanked the stock market in a single morning.

 The politcal forums here have kind of calmed down a little bit. Most of the fanatical bush supporters are gone or have quited down quite a bit. There is very definatly an "oh my god, I cut off my willy" undertone to most of their posts now, when they bother to post at all.
 
 It is almost like now that all the rationals for the Iraq war have evaporated, it it has become apparent that we have expended hundreds of billions of dollars and killed hundreds of thousadns of people in order to install a governemtn in Iraq that is closely alinged with that of Iran. North Korea is threatening to make the west coast disapear under a mushroom cloud unless we give them billions of dollars. It is almost like an old james bond movie...we should just start calling the N Korean government "Spectre" and get Sean Connery to negotiate with them and you would have it all. The russians are selling Syria arms and nuclear facilties, whether we like it or not. Iran is thumbing their nose at us and forming alliances with Syria and their neat new russian military toys. Al Queda has now quadrupled in size and has nearly 10x the money they did pre 9/11. Our deficit is through the roof, and the dollar is dropping like a rock.
 
 It is almost like the bush fanatics have stepped back and gone "well, we certainly ****ed that one up"
